CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Such high energy alignment would not enable to achieve a large open - circuit voltage and is eventually detrimental to the PCE output of PT - based PSCs such as in P3HT / PCBM systems with PCE ranging from 3 to 4% . 21,22 Geng and co-workers synthesized two PT - based donor materials by incorporating carboxylate side chains and vinylene linkers between thiophene units. The HOMO and the lowest unoccupied molecular orbital ( LUMO ) energy levels of the resulting polymers , PBT and PTT , were substantially stabilized when compared to those of the parent P3HT. Such energy level lowering was attributed to the integration of carboxylate and vinylene groups giving rise to a push - pull structural motif , resulting in an enhanced PCE of the PV devices based on them. 21 Over the years , the use of the structural effect to enhance PSC performance has been extensively investigated , particularly the donor - acceptor ( D-A ) strategy , which has been proved to be an effective approach to develop donor polymers with wide absorption , low - lying energy levels , and enhanced electron properties. 23-32 Besides , conjugation expansion on the polymer backbone is an alternative tool to improve the electronic properties of polymers. By replacing a branched 2ethylhexyl side chain with a linear n-octyl group , Zhang and his co-workers synthesized a PTB7-Th derivative namely , PBTT. PV cells based on PBTT : IEICO showed a superior device performance than that of the PTB7-Th - based device with a PCE of 9.5% , a V oc of 0.86 V , a J sc of 17.9 mA cm^-2 , and a FF of 61.3% . Such dramatic enhancement in efficiency was attributed to a higher charge mobility and improved morphology of the PBTT : IEICO blend film induced by the less steric hindered linear alkyl side chain. 1 Yang and coworkers used selenophene to replace thiophene π-bridge in the indacenodithiophene (IDT)-benzo[1,2-c:4,5-c′]dithiophene-4,8-dione (BDD)-based copolymer ( PThBDDIDT ) to develop a donor-π-acceptor type copolymer , PSeBDDIDT. The PCE of solar cells based on polymer : PC71BM as an active layer was dramatically increased from 7.04 to 8.65% , respectively. Such improvement could result from stronger intermolecular interactions , expanded absorption range , and better molecular planarity of selenophene contained PSeBDDIDT. 33 Random terpolymers comprised of thieno[2′,3′ : 5′,6′]pyrido [ 3,4- g]- thieno[3,2-c]isoquinoline-5,11(4H,10H)-dione , thiophene( T ) , and dithiophene ( 2T ) were synthesized by Yang and co-workers in which the crystallinity of terpolymers could be controlled by varying the compositions of T and 2T. The PSC based on a terpolymer with the optimized T / 2T ratio of 7 : 3 showed a high J sc of 18.3 mA cm^-2 and a FF of 71.2% , thus resulting in an enhanced PCE up to 10.8% . 34 Fluorination on polymer backbones has also been widely adopted to tune and improve the functional properties of donor polymers such as stabilization of their energy levels and hence positively impacting on PSC performance.

Let's think step by step.

The "Material Name" entities in the paragraph can be identified as follows:

1. P3HT
2. PCBM
3. PT
4. PBT
5. PTT
6. PBTT
7. PThBDDIDT
8. PSeBDDIDT
9. T (thieno[2′,3′ : 5′,6′]pyrido [3,4-g]-thieno[3,2-c]isoquinoline-5,11(4H,10H)-dione)
10. 2T (dithiophene)
11. PTB7-Th
12. PB7-Th
13. IEICO
14. PC71BM

Note that some of the material names are mentioned multiple times in the paragraph, but they are listed here only once.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

Sure, here are the entities that clearly refer to Material Name in the given paragraph:

1. P3HT
2. PT
3. PBT
4. PTT
5. PBTT
6. PThBDDIDT
7. PSeBDDIDT

These are the materials that are mentioned as having been synthesized or used in the development of solar cells. The other entities mentioned in the paragraph, such as IEICO and PC71BM, are not Material Names, but rather names of specific compounds or materials that are used in the synthesis or application of the materials listed above.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Sure, here's a Markdown table with the valid entities in the "Material Name" column:

| Material Name |
| --- |
| P3HT |
| PT |
| PBT |
| PTT |
| PBTT |
| PThBDDIDT |
| PSeBDDIDT |

PN.content:
Please identify the Property Names of materials in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Such high energy alignment would not enable to achieve a large open - circuit voltage and is eventually detrimental to the PCE output of PT - based PSCs such as in P3HT / PCBM systems with PCE ranging from 3 to 4% . 21,22 Geng and co-workers synthesized two PT - based donor materials by incorporating carboxylate side chains and vinylene linkers between thiophene units. The HOMO and the lowest unoccupied molecular orbital ( LUMO ) energy levels of the resulting polymers , PBT and PTT , were substantially stabilized when compared to those of the parent P3HT. Such energy level lowering was attributed to the integration of carboxylate and vinylene groups giving rise to a push - pull structural motif , resulting in an enhanced PCE of the PV devices based on them. 21 Over the years , the use of the structural effect to enhance PSC performance has been extensively investigated , particularly the donor - acceptor ( D-A ) strategy , which has been proved to be an effective approach to develop donor polymers with wide absorption , low - lying energy levels , and enhanced electron properties. 23-32 Besides , conjugation expansion on the polymer backbone is an alternative tool to improve the electronic properties of polymers. By replacing a branched 2ethylhexyl side chain with a linear n-octyl group , Zhang and his co-workers synthesized a PTB7-Th derivative namely , PBTT. PV cells based on PBTT : IEICO showed a superior device performance than that of the PTB7-Th - based device with a PCE of 9.5% , a V oc of 0.86 V , a J sc of 17.9 mA cm^-2 , and a FF of 61.3% . Such dramatic enhancement in efficiency was attributed to a higher charge mobility and improved morphology of the PBTT : IEICO blend film induced by the less steric hindered linear alkyl side chain. 1 Yang and coworkers used selenophene to replace thiophene π-bridge in the indacenodithiophene (IDT)-benzo[1,2-c:4,5-c′]dithiophene-4,8-dione (BDD)-based copolymer ( PThBDDIDT ) to develop a donor-π-acceptor type copolymer , PSeBDDIDT. The PCE of solar cells based on polymer : PC71BM as an active layer was dramatically increased from 7.04 to 8.65% , respectively. Such improvement could result from stronger intermolecular interactions , expanded absorption range , and better molecular planarity of selenophene contained PSeBDDIDT. 33 Random terpolymers comprised of thieno[2′,3′ : 5′,6′]pyrido [ 3,4- g]- thieno[3,2-c]isoquinoline-5,11(4H,10H)-dione , thiophene( T ) , and dithiophene ( 2T ) were synthesized by Yang and co-workers in which the crystallinity of terpolymers could be controlled by varying the compositions of T and 2T. The PSC based on a terpolymer with the optimized T / 2T ratio of 7 : 3 showed a high J sc of 18.3 mA cm^-2 and a FF of 71.2% , thus resulting in an enhanced PCE up to 10.8% . 34 Fluorination on polymer backbones has also been widely adopted to tune and improve the functional properties of donor polymers such as stabilization of their energy levels and hence positively impacting on PSC performance.

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Let's identify the property names of materials in the paragraph.

1. P3HT - Poly(3-hexylthiophene)
2. PCBM - [6,6]-Phenyl-C61-butyric acid methyl ester
3. PBT - Poly(benzothiophene)
4. PTT - Poly(thienylene vinylene)
5. PTB7-Th - Poly(thienylene vinylene) with a branched 2-ethylhexyl side chain
6. PBTT - Poly(thienylene vinylene) with a linear n-octyl side chain
7. PThBDDIDT - Poly(thienylene-benzo[1,2-c:4,5-c']dithiophene-4,8-dione)
8. PSeBDDIDT - Poly(selenophene-benzo[1,2-c:4,5-c']dithiophene-4,8-dione)
9. T - Thiophene
10. 2T - Dithiophene
11. IDT - Indacenodithiophene
12. BDD - Benzo[1,2-c:4,5-c']dithiophene-4,8-dione
13. PC71BM - [6,6]-Phenyl-C71-butyric acid methyl ester
14. PSe - Selenophene

Please let me know if you need any further assistance!
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Property Name of Material.

Sure, here are the entities that clearly refer to Property Name of Material:

1. P3HT
2. PBT
3. PTT
4. PTB7-Th
5. PBTT
6. PThBDDIDT
7. PSeBDDIDT

These are the materials mentioned in the paragraph with their property names, which are poly(3-hexylthiophene) (P3HT), poly(benzothiophene) (PBT), poly(thienylene vinylene) (PTT), poly(thienylene vinylene) with a branched 2-ethylhexyl side chain (PTB7-Th), poly(thienylene vinylene) with a linear n-octyl side chain (PBTT), poly(thienylene-benzo[1,2-c:4,5-c']dithiophene-4,8-dione) (PThBDDIDT), and poly(selenophene-benzo[1,2-c:4,5-c']dithiophene-4,8-dione) (PSeBDDIDT).

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Sure, here's a Markdown table with the valid entities presented in the same words as in the original paragraph:

| Property Name |
| --- |
| P3HT |
| PBT |
| PTT |
| PTB7-Th |
| PBTT |
| PThBDDIDT |
| PSeBDDIDT |

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.

PV.content:
Please identify the Values (number + unit) of material properties in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Such high energy alignment would not enable to achieve a large open - circuit voltage and is eventually detrimental to the PCE output of PT - based PSCs such as in P3HT / PCBM systems with PCE ranging from 3 to 4% . 21,22 Geng and co-workers synthesized two PT - based donor materials by incorporating carboxylate side chains and vinylene linkers between thiophene units. The HOMO and the lowest unoccupied molecular orbital ( LUMO ) energy levels of the resulting polymers , PBT and PTT , were substantially stabilized when compared to those of the parent P3HT. Such energy level lowering was attributed to the integration of carboxylate and vinylene groups giving rise to a push - pull structural motif , resulting in an enhanced PCE of the PV devices based on them. 21 Over the years , the use of the structural effect to enhance PSC performance has been extensively investigated , particularly the donor - acceptor ( D-A ) strategy , which has been proved to be an effective approach to develop donor polymers with wide absorption , low - lying energy levels , and enhanced electron properties. 23-32 Besides , conjugation expansion on the polymer backbone is an alternative tool to improve the electronic properties of polymers. By replacing a branched 2ethylhexyl side chain with a linear n-octyl group , Zhang and his co-workers synthesized a PTB7-Th derivative namely , PBTT. PV cells based on PBTT : IEICO showed a superior device performance than that of the PTB7-Th - based device with a PCE of 9.5% , a V oc of 0.86 V , a J sc of 17.9 mA cm^-2 , and a FF of 61.3% . The PCE of solar cells based on polymer : PC71BM as an active layer was dramatically increased from 7.04 to 8.65% , respectively. Such improvement could result from stronger intermolecular interactions , expanded absorption range , and better molecular planarity of selenophene contained PSeBDDIDT. 33 Random terpolymers comprised of thieno[2′,3′ : 5′,6′]pyrido [ 3,4- g]- thieno[3,2-c]isoquinoline-5,11(4H,10H)-dione , thiophene( T ) , and dithiophene ( 2T ) were synthesized by Yang and co-workers in which the crystallinity of terpolymers could be controlled by varying the compositions of T and 2T. The PSC based on a terpolymer with the optimized T / 2T ratio of 7 : 3 showed a high J sc of 18.3 mA cm^-2 and a FF of 71.2% , thus resulting in an enhanced PCE up to 10.8% . 34 Fluorination on polymer backbones has also been widely adopted to tune and improve the functional properties of donor polymers such as stabilization of their energy levels and hence positively impacting on PSC performance.

Let's think step by step.

1. First, let's identify the material properties mentioned in the paragraph:

* Open-circuit voltage (Voc)
* Power conversion efficiency (PCE)
* Fill factor (FF)
* Current density (Jsc)
* HOMO (highest occupied molecular orbital) energy level
* LUMO (lowest unoccupied molecular orbital) energy level
* Charge mobility
* Morphology
* Absorption range
* Molecular planarity
* Intermolecular interactions
2. Next, let's look for the values of these material properties mentioned in the paragraph:

* Voc: 0.86 V (for PBTT : IEICO)
* PCE: 9.5% (for PBTT : IEICO), 8.65% (for PSeBDDIDT), 10.8% (for terpolymer with optimized T/2T ratio)
* FF: 61.3% (for PBTT : IEICO), 71.2% (for terpolymer with optimized T/2T ratio)
* Jsc: 17.9 mA cm^-2 (for PBTT : IEICO), 18.3 mA cm^-2 (for terpolymer with optimized T/2T ratio)
* HOMO energy level: stabilized (for PBT and PTT)
* LUMO energy level: stabilized (for PBT and PTT)
* Charge mobility: improved (for PBTT : IEICO)
* Morphology: improved (for PBTT : IEICO)
* Absorption range: expanded (for PSeBDDIDT)
* Molecular planarity: improved (for PSeBDDIDT)
* Intermolecular interactions: stronger (for PSeBDDIDT)

Note that some of these values are not explicitly mentioned in the paragraph, but can be inferred from the context.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

Sure, here's the updated list of entities that refer to the Value of Material Property:

1. Voc (open-circuit voltage)
2. PCE (power conversion efficiency)
3. FF (fill factor)
4. Jsc (current density)
5. HOMO energy level
6. LUMO energy level

These are the entities that directly refer to the value of material properties in the context of solar cells. The other entities mentioned in the previous list, such as "morphology," "absorption range," and "intermolecular interactions," are important factors that can affect the performance of solar cells, but they are not direct measures of material property values.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Sure, here's the table with the valid entities presented in the same words as in the original paragraph:

| Property Value |
| --- |
| 0.86 V |
| 9.5% |
| 61.3% |
| 17.9 mA cm^-2 |
| stabilized |
